program: Honours in International Studies and Modern Languages
notes: In order to obtain a degree in International Studies and Modern Languages, students must successfully complete 24 course credits in their second language (FLS). A student may be exempted from this requirement if they successfully complete the Second Language Certification test (FLS 3500) with a minimum of two scores of at least 3 and no score below 2.

In order to obtain a degree in International Studies and Modern Languages, students must have reached advanced level II in one of the following languages and taken at least three course credits in a non-language course (culture and civilization): Arabic, Chinese, German, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese, Russian or Spanish.
